content.description:
Pretty good crack climbing for the first half then flaring but easy terrain.  Left facing corner to the left of black pine face.  A 70 meter rope will get you to a good belay ledge (.75 and smaller cams or larger gear in a big flake) were you can walk off to climbers left.  There are a couple class 4 moves to get down.  Can also traverse this ledge up and to the right to get to the upper ledges.

Cleaned on 6/5/20
content.protection: double rack to 3 and set of nuts.

climbs.name: Momentary Lapse of Reason
climbs.fa: Paul Soboleski, Dave Turner, Larry Linik,  Sept. 1990

content.description:
A long and mostly moderate slab climb that was originally led on poorly placed pitonssomething to ponder while sketching your way up the runout to the anchor!  This route is easily top roped after leading Black Pine Chimney or Black Pine Face.

Begin at the base of the slab about 40 feet down from Black Pine Face.  Follow the bolts to the top.   It is possible to move left into Black Pine Face after a few bolts and keep the grade at 5.8 all the way to the top.

This well protected bolt line climbs the clean face to the right of Black Pine Chimney and should not to be missed.

From the Black Pine tree, clip the obvious bolt on the arête, then balance and smear up the excellent face to the belay ledge and a rappel anchor.
content.protection: Quickdraws. Add one ½ piece between bolt 1 & 2
content.location: Find the bolted line near the Black Pine Tree

content.description:
This is the obvious chimney slot just left of the Black Pine Tree.

A really fun chimney that can be climbed facing in or out.  Either way, work up an increasingly tight squeeze until popping out on a bolted belay ledge.
